etymologies: early 19th century. From scientific Latin Todea, genus name from the name of Heinrich Julius Tode, German naturalist + scientific Latin -a

definitions: Any of several ferns of the southern hemisphere genus Todea (family Osmundaceae), or formerly included in it; also called crepe fern; especially the king fern, T. barbara.

notes.text: Ferns formerly known as the ‘filmy todeas’ are now placed in the genus Leptopteris.
